problem.markdown:
The magnitude of energy required to change the conformation of a molecule is called dihedral (or torsional) energy.
(X) True ( ) False
Gauche conformation forces the large methyl groups in Butane to be near each other, resulting in steric strain.
(x) True ( ) False
The potential energy at large separation's is essentially the bond energy
( )True (x) False
The dihedral angle of four atoms φ varies only the distance between the first and third atoms; the other interatomic distances are constrained by the chemical bond lengths and bond angles
( )True (x) False
Steric strain is the repulsive interaction that occurs when two groups are forced to be closer to each other than their atomic radii allow;
(x) True ( ) False
problem.p: The magnitude of energy required to change the conformation of a molecule is called dihedral (or torsional) energy.
Gauche conformation forces the large methyl groups in Butane to be near each other, resulting in steric strain.
The potential energy at large separation's is essentially the bond energy
The dihedral angle of four atoms φ varies only the distance between the first and third atoms; the other interatomic distances are constrained by the chemical bond lengths and bond angles
Steric strain is the repulsive interaction that occurs when two groups are forced to be closer to each other than their atomic radii allow;
